measurement.name: humidity
measurement.description: Relative humidity is a measure of the amount of moisture in the air relative to the total amount of moisture the air can hold. For instance, if the relative humidity was 50%, then the air is only half saturated with moisture.

measurement.name: air temperature
measurement.description: Air temperature is a measure of how hot or cold the air is. It is the most commonly measured weather parameter. Air temperature is dependent on the amount and strength of the sunlight hitting the earth, and atmospheric conditions, such as cloud cover and humidity, which trap heat.

measurement.name: nets
measurement.description: The amount of Wi-Fi networks visible by the SCK.

measurement.name: light
measurement.description: Lux is a measure of how much light is spread over a given area. A full moon clear night is around 1 lux, inside an office building you usually have 400 lux and a bright day can be more than 20000 lux.

measurement.name: mA
measurement.description: Current

measurement.name: no2
measurement.description: Nitrogen dioxide is a toxic gas. measurement.name: ionising radiation
measurement.description: Ionising radiation (ionizing radiation) is radiation that carries enough energy to free electrons from atoms or molecules, thereby ionizing them. Gamma rays, X-rays, and the higher ultraviolet part of the electromagnetic spectrum are ionizing.

measurement.name: co aux electrode
measurement.description: In Alphasense Series B Electrochemical Sensors, the auxiliary electrode is an electrode of the same characteristics to those of the working electrode, but it is buried inside an electrolite and, hence, it is not in contact with the target gas. Since it is isolated from external conditions that could affect the working electrode, it serves as a reference to the measurements provided by the latter.

measurement.name: o3 aux electrode

description: Digital gas sensor for monitoring indoor air quality

name: AMS CCS811 - eCO2
description: Equivalent Carbon Dioxide Digital Indoor Sensor

measurement.name: eCO2
measurement.description: Equivalent CO2 is the concentration of CO2 that would cause the same level of radiative forcing as a given type and concentration of greenhouse gas. Examples of such greenhouse gases are methane, perfluorocarbons, and nitrous oxide. CO2 is primarily a by-product of human metabolism and is constantly being emitted into the indoor environment by building occupants. CO2 may come from combustion sources as well. Associations of higher indoor carbon dioxide concentrations with impaired work performance and increased health symptoms have been attributed to correlation of indoor CO2 with concentrations of other indoor air pollutants that are also influenced by rates of outdoor-air ventilation.

name: AMS CCS811 - TVOC
description: Total Volatile Organic Compounds Digital Indoor Sensor

measurement.name: TVOC
measurement.description: Total volatile organic compounds is a grouping of a wide range of organic chemical compounds to simplify reporting when these are present in ambient air or emissions. Many substances, such as natural gas, could be classified as volatile organic compounds (VOCs).

measurement.description: PM stands for particulate matter: the term for a mixture of solid particles and liquid droplets found in the air. Some particles, such as dust, dirt, soot, or smoke, are large or dark enough to be seen with the naked eye.

measurement.name: soil moisture
measurement.description: Relative measure of the concentration of water that is dissolved in soil.

measurement.name: air temperature
measurement.description: Air temperature is a measure of how hot or cold the air is. It is the most commonly measured weather parameter. Air temperature is dependent on the amount and strength of the sunlight hitting the earth, and atmospheric conditions, such as cloud cover and humidity, which trap heat.

measurement.name: humidity
measurement.description: Relative humidity is a measure of the amount of moisture in the air relative to the total amount of moisture the air can hold. For instance, if the relative humidity was 50%, then the air is only half saturated with moisture.

measurement.name: formaldehydes
measurement.description: Formaldehyde is an important chemical used widely by industry to manufacture building materials and numerous household products. It is also a by-product of combustion and certain other natural processes. Thus, it may be present in substantial concentrations both indoors and outdoors. It can cause irritation of the skin, eyes, nose and throat.

name: PM_BOARD_COUNTER
description: Pulse Button Counter on the PM Board

measurement.name: counts
measurement.description: Counts pulses for buttons and other counters

measurement.name: Salinity
measurement.description: Salinity is the saltiness or amount of salt dissolved in a body of water, is an important factor in determining many aspects of the chemistry of natural waters and of biological processes within it, and is a thermodynamic state variable that, along with temperature and pressure, governs physical characteristics like the density and heat capacity of the water.

name: AS EZO Total Dissolved Solids
description: Atlas Scientific EZOO Total Dissolved Solids

measurement.name: TDS
measurement.description: Total Dissolved Solids is a measure of the dissolved combined content of all inorganic and organic substances present in a liquid in molecular, ionized, or micro-granular suspended form.

measurement.name: Latitude
measurement.description: In geography, latitude is a geographic coordinate that specifies the north–south position of a point on the Earth's surface. Latitude is an angle which ranges from 0° at the Equator to 90° at the poles

measurement.name: Longitude
measurement.description: In geography, longitude is a geographic coordinate that specifies the east–west position of a point on the Earth's surface. Longitude is an angle which ranges from 0° at the Prime meridian (Greenwich) to 90° at the 180th meridian or antimeridian

measurement.name: Altitude
measurement.description: Height above mean sea level (AMSL) is a measure of the vertical distance (height, elevation or altitude) of a location in reference to a historic mean sea level taken as a vertical datum.

measurement.name: Fix Quality
measurement.description: See codes: 0 = invalid, 1 = GPS fix (SPS), 2 = DGPS fix, 3 = PPS fix, 4 = Real Time Kinematic, 5 = Float RTK, 6 = estimated (dead reckoning) (2.3 feature), 7 = Manual input mode, 8 = Simulation mode

measurement.name: Ground Speed
measurement.description: Speed over the ground in knots

measurement.name: Satellites
measurement.description: Number of satellites being tracked

measurement.name: Horizontal dilution
measurement.description: Horizontal dilution of position. Dilution of precision, or geometric dilution of precision, is a term used in satellite navigation and geomatics engineering to specify the Error propagation as a mathematical effect of navigation satellite geometry on positional measurement precision.

name: ADC_4B_3
description: 16-bit Analog to Digital Converter - ADS1X15 addr. 4B ch. 3

measurement.name: ADC in V
measurement.description: Analog Digital Converter result in Volts

description: 16-bit Analog to Digital Converter - ADS1X15 addr. 48
